User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the system.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo, stored in Firebase Storage.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project in the system.

ownerId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Project).  The user who owns/created the project.

memberIds.description: References to Users. (Relationship: Project N:N User). Users that are members of the project.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task within a project.

projectId.description: Reference to Project. (Relationship: Project 1:N Task). The project this task belongs to.

description.description: Detailed description of the task (rich text).

status.description: Status of the task (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Blocked, Done).

assigneeId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Task).  The user assigned to the task.

priority.description: Priority of the task (e.g., High, Medium, Low).

tagIds.description: References to Tags. (Relationship: Task N:N Tag)

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag that can be associated with tasks.

color.description: Color associated with the tag (e.g., hex code).

Subtask.title: Subtask
Subtask.description: Represents a subtask within a task.

taskId.description: Reference to Task. (Relationship: Task 1:N Subtask). The task this subtask belongs to.

isCompleted.description: Indicates whether the subtask is completed.

Attachment.title: Attachment
Attachment.description: Represents a file attachment for a task.

taskId.description: Reference to Task. (Relationship: Task 1:N Attachment).  The task this attachment belongs to.

fileURL.description: URL of the file in Firebase Storage.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the attached file

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a task.

taskId.description: Reference to Task. (Relationship: Task 1:N Comment). The task this comment belongs to.

authorId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Comment).  The user who authored the comment.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the comment was created.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification for a user.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Notification). The user this notification is for.

taskId.description: Reference to Task.  The relevant task (if any).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the notification was created.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the notification has been read.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and efficient data access for the Zenos Project application. It leverages path-based ownership and membership maps to avoid complex `get()` calls in security rules.  The structure supports the core features of the application, including real-time presence and intelligent notifications, while adhering to the principles of clarity, predictability, and scalability.

**Authorization Independence:** Authorization independence is achieved through denormalization. Project member information is denormalized into the `tasks` collection, enabling task-level authorization without needing to fetch project documents. This is crucial for atomic operations and simplifies security rules.  The presence of `memberIds` within Project documents and the denormalization into `tasks` enables listing projects a user is a member of, as well as tasks assigned or related to members of a project.

**Structural Segregation:**  The structure segregates data with different security needs. User profiles are stored in a private collection (`/users/{userId}`), while project and task data are organized in separate collections to allow for more granular access control.

**Access Modeling:**  Path-based ownership is used for user-specific data (e.g., `/users/{userId}/notifications/{notificationId}`). Membership maps are used for collaborative data, with `memberIds` in the `/projects/{projectId}` document.

**QAPs Support:**

*   **List Projects:** A user can list projects they own or are members of by querying the `/projects` collection and filtering based on the `ownerId` or `memberIds` array.
*   **List Tasks:** A user can list tasks within a project by querying the `/projects/{projectId}/tasks` collection. Denormalization of `memberIds` into tasks enable simple rules to guarantee QAPs.
*   **Secure Task Access:** Access to individual tasks is controlled by the `assigneeId` and project `memberIds`. Security rules can easily enforce that only the assignee or project members can read/write a task.

**Real-time Presence:**  Presence data (who is viewing a task) is stored in a separate collection (`/presence/{taskId}/{userId}`), allowing for real-time updates without affecting the main task data.

**Intelligent Notifications:** Notifications are stored in a user-specific collection (`/users/{userId}/notifications/{notificationId}`), ensuring that only the intended user can access their notifications.

**Search:** Global search would ideally be handled by a dedicated search index (Algolia as suggested), but a simple implementation could be achieved using collection group queries and client-side filtering (though this is not scalable for large datasets).
